articles.description: Meltdown and Spectre, dossier drama, and more of the week's top security news.

articles.title: Op-Ed Columnist: Let’s Try to Get Past Trump

articles.description: Mr. Trump, seeming to respond to revelations in a new book, issued an extraordinary defense of his fitness for office.
articles.title: Trump Defends His Mental Capacity, Calling Himself a ‘Genius’
articles.author: MICHAEL TACKETT

articles.description: Senator Orrin G. Hatch, Republican of Utah, after the tax bill passed last month. He plans to retire at the end of the year.
articles.title: Opinion: Retirement Tips for the Age of Trump
articles.author: CHARLES J. SYKES

articles.description: The country has played a double game, accepting American funding while backing militants who protect Pakistani interests in Afghanistan and Kashmir.
articles.title: Editorial: Pakistan, the Endlessly Troublesome Ally

articles.description: For decades, they warned the North was making progress on a missile that could reach the United States. But the last breakthroughs happened faster than they expected.
articles.title: How U.S. Intelligence Agencies Underestimated North Korea
articles.author: DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD

articles.description: It's common knowledge by now that Donald Trump isn't much of a reader. That fact alone suggests he probably won't get through a full read of Michael Wolff's explosive, new book, Fire and Fury: Inside the Trump White House. Fortunately, one talented individual…
articles.title: Clever artist turns Michael Wolff's 'Fire and Fury' into a hilarious pop-up book
articles.author: Adam Rosenberg

articles.description: 2018 sure is off to a running start in Trumpland. The 45th President of the United States kicked off a busy weekend of meetings at Camp David on Saturday with a brief, fiery tweetstorm that — even at this early point in 2018 — is already a surefire candidate …
articles.title: Despite bombshell book, Donald Trump wants all of you to know he's 'like, really smart'
articles.author: Adam Rosenberg

articles.description: Donald Trump had one of his most unforgettable series of tweets Saturday morning, touting his own mental stability, claiming that he's, "like, really smart," and calling himself a genius. SEE ALSO: Pete Souza throws shade at Trump for 'nuclear button' tweet P…
articles.title: Pete Souza had the perfect reaction to Trump's 'like, really smart' tweets
articles.author: Kellen Beck

articles.description: President Trump with top congressional Republicans and administration officials at Camp David on Saturday. Mr. Trump said that Republicans were looking at changes to the nation’s welfare laws, but that they would have to be done on a bipartisan basis.
articles.title: ‘Everything I’ve Done Is 100 Percent Proper,’ Trump Says of Russia Inquiry
articles.author: MICHAEL TACKETT

articles.description: Restricted from operating in the United States, most Mexican drivers must hand off their cargo. The Trump administration wants even tighter controls.
articles.title: From Mexico to the U.S., a Nafta Tale of Two Truckers
articles.author: NATALIE KITROEFF and GEORGE ETHEREDGE

articles.description: At a recent hearing, Senator Lamar Alexander of Tennessee pressed scientists to explain exactly how gene editing technology could lead to new treatments for sickle cell anemia, H.I.V., cystic fibrosis, Alzheimer’s and other diseases.
articles.title: Exotic Medical Research? Congress Swoons. Basic Medical Care? Congress Brawls.
articles.author: ROBERT PEAR

articles.description: The case for the New York City subway. Meet the men’s Olympic figure skating champ who loves Winnie the Pooh. Read up on Golden Globe nominees and how sexual harassment scandals may change the red carpet.
articles.title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads

articles.description: Arab governments publicly condemned President Trump’s statement on Jerusalem but criticism in state-owned and pro-government media across the Arab world was muted.
articles.title: Tapes Reveal Egyptian Leaders’ Tacit Acceptance of Jerusalem Move
articles.author: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

articles.description: Gail Trachtenberg and Lewis Eron prepaid part of their 2018 property tax bill at the township building in Cherry Hill, N.J. last month. Officials in New Jersey and in other high-tax states are trying to find ways to blunt the effects of the federal tax plan.
articles.title: Taxes as Charity? New Jersey Towns Try to Elude G.O.P. Tax Law
articles.author: NICK CORASANITI and ALAN RAPPEPORT
